content: colour repeat the moss stitch and eyelet sections until you have used approximately 80% of your yarn or you join your final colour short row maintaining the pattern as established work short row as follows rs kfb work in pattern until approximately five stitches remain finishing on a knit stitch w&t ws work in pattern to last two stitches kfb sl1 rs kfb work in pattern until five stitches before previous w&t where you will see a small gap between the stitches on the needle w&t ws work in pattern to last two kfb sl1 2 continue in this manner until you have ten or fewer stitches in your short row or you only have enough yarn left for approximately six row or you like the length of your shawl rs kfb work in pattern across whole row to last two stitches k2tog ws sl1 work in pattern to last two stitches kfb sl1 picot cast off on a right side row cast on two stitches using knitted cast on method then cast off four stitches slip remaining stitch on right hand needle back onto left hand needle repeat this process until only one stitch remains break yarn and draw through weave in the yarn ends and block your mossy shawl pattern by catherine djimramadji september 2025 all rights reserved 3
